values:
The following is my quotes journal which i started when i was 16.  Enjoy.


This is my writing book which I dub....
Loquen
   by KenBall


November 13, 1995
What happens to a fallen hero?  Does he live on in our hearts, or die like a fading dream?

Kindness is the ability to sacrifice and suffer for another.

My Heroic Oath I am the hero.  I fight for truth, justice, and honor.  Until the day death shines its dim light upon me, my fight will never end.

November 14, 1995
Help those in pain, but forgive those who caused it.

December 31, 1995
Though you may try, it is much harder to relight a burnt match
than it is to light a new one.

May 26, 1996
All learning begins with four words:  I do not know.

You may know thousands of ways to take a life but, unfortunately, not one way to give it.

Part of love is:  Trusting someone you have no reason to trust, making a promise to someone you've just met, and doing this for the rest of your life.

There can be only one.  -Highlander

May 27, 1996
It's better to die on your feet than to live on your knees.
                -Worf, Magneto

Not until you drink from the cup of death can you taste life.


From the moment we're born we've already begun to die.
  -Chris Martin

A thought about the past is a memory.  A thought about the future is a dream.
  -KenBall

May 29, 1996
One measure of leadership is the caliber of people who choose to follow you.

Success is never final, but failure can be.

No one tries to fail, but many fail to try.

Where there is great love, there are always miracles.

Great love and great achievement often involve great risk.

Never does the human soul appear so strong and noble as when it forgoes revenge and dares to forgive an injury.

You can measure a man by the opposition it takes to discourage him.

May 30, 1996
Every man dies.  Not every man really lives.
  -William Wallace

Stand up for what is right, even if you're standing alone.

There are no limits for journeys of the mind.

June 1, 1996
Never start a fight, but always finish it.
  -Captain John Sheridan's father

Love isn't blind.  Only lovers are.
  -KenBall

June 7, 1996
A hero is someone who does the right thing when the right thing isn't the easy thing to do.
  -George Feeny

An obstacle causes some men to break.  Others, to break records.

Wisdom and experience is not found by reaching the destination, but on the journey towards it.
  -KenBall                                                              
June 8, 1996
The most fulfilling moment in any heroes' quest is the point when he is no longer needed.

June 14, 1996
The only thing necessary for evil to triumph is for good men
to stand by and do nothing.
  -Duncan MacLeod of the clan MacLeod

The purpose of the hero is not to change the world, but to make the people change themselves.
  -KenBall

Experience is a hard teacher because it always gives the test first and the lesson after.

July 25, 1996
True heroism can be defined as an unrelenting application of intelligence, courage, and skill to the battle against the forces of evil. 
  -Ted Koppel
August 19, 1996
Sometimes the only time you can see the light is when you're in the darkness.

Asking for help is a strength, not a weakness.

Life without obstacles is worth nothing.  Love without risk is worth the same.
  -Jonathan Kent


June 10, 1997
It's not the world that I am changing, I do this so this world will know it will not change me.
-Garth Brooks

A Hero should be like a star, burning as bright as it can during  its lifetime then dying in one final burst of the brightest light it has ever produced, setting an example so that the other stars, planets, and the entire cosmos will never forget.
-KenBall

November 10, 1997
How can I exist without you?
-Stabbing Westward

Everything I've hoped to be or ever thought I was died with your belief in me so who the hell am I?
-Stabbing Westward

You can have it all, you just can't have it all at once.
 -Oprah Winfrey

July 10, 1999
KenBall:  Protect this with your life....
B.J.:  I'll protect it beyond death.

i can see myself standing on a rock floating through pitch black darkness,
 hearing nothing but the sound of wind howling around me, and my internal heart
 screams begging for all life to stop...the last thing i remember is the tears
in her eyes as our dreams were broken only for hers to begin again; the unbroken
silence of my non-existent defiance and the cold stares of love's unkindled flame 
spread over me like this blanket of loneliness that won't keep me warm in the vastness of space, 
now lightyears away from the contentment that being wrapped in her arms could bring even on the 
worst of days...and now i feel myself fading out of existance...and now i know i was born of her
love and fighting for her would have been fighting for myself but my strength is gone and my love 
alone is never enough to make her need me to be.
I want to write a novel.  How do I begin?

Okay...I've abandoned my huge core audience. hahaha.

Lately, my life has been impacted by two new obsessions, which are the following: my first ever MMORPG, City of Heroes; and (surprise!) a TV show, Lost.

I say surprise because the last thing I watched on TV was the moon landing (and I wasn't even alive for that one...)  I recommend it to anyone who likes a good story.

AS far as CoH goes, I have a level 28 technology tanker on the freedom server named Chip.  (that period doesn't end the sentence, it's actually part of his name; so if ya wanna look me up there ya go...)

Well, that's been my life for the past two months...interesting, huh.

P. S.  I've also read White Oleander by Janet Fitch and The Princess Bride:  The Good Parts Version by William Goldman, both great...
I'll also be 26 in two weeks....erg...argh...

deathfirst's LJ stalker is booktard!
booktard is stalking you because they have nothing better to do with their time. They are also eating your food when you aren't looking!

I've been trying to "expand my horizons" lately.  Trying to reawaken my dormant intelligence.  Grow as an individual.  It's good to know my mind hasn't completely athrophied into a useless mass.  I've started reading again, and I've found that I've missed it.

Moving on, the purpose of this entry is sort of a request for mental stimulation through suggestions of interesting/clever music, books, movies, news articles, etc...working at a job a mindless drone could do for the past 5 and a half years has taken its toll on my mental fortitude.

I would like to see myself go back to school (someday) when I can afford it, which is hopefully within 6 months to a year (yeah, right); rather than waste my intelligence clerkin'.

Oh well, Later...

...to make sure the tragic death of an innocent child is never allowed to happen again.  And to make sure shitheads like Couey that deserve to pay for their crimes won't be allowed to walk free to strike again and again.  

Go to http://www.protectfloridachildren.com to download copies of Jessica's Petition.  100,000 signatures are needed so lets do all we can to protect the future of our children.

well first things first credit where credit is due...my flippin' sweet icon was created by venusnin, not me.  Thank you venusnin.

Vampiric Rebirth 

Death is what happens when you accept that your life is over...
And falling in love is what happens when you can't hold on to yourself...Imagine if you couldn't remember what is real...Who you are, what you think, or how you feel...All is lost except for one thing........Your hunger....for blood...

If blood-stained hands can never be pure...then you are truly damned...for the sins you commit course eternally through your veins...Life everlasting doesn't mean as much with out someone to hold...and you're dead inside....

Can a beast as dark and as cruel as you be capable of even tasting love...You've tasted life and death...but there are certain things even you have grown numb to...Is one of those things your soul?


Invisible Sunshine

She had an inner brilliance no one ever saw--
No one ever saw but you and me
Never really given the chance to truly shine
We taught her how to find herself
The power deep inside
We showed her the invisible sunshine 
That gleamed inside of her
At first she took us with a grain of salt
But then she finally began to see
That all her life she'd been living in the shade
Never knowing the latent greatness 
That exists inside her heart--
The only true power she ever needed
She saw inside herself
Now we're blinded by her invisible sunshine
Who could have known it would shine so bright?


So every body tell me what ya think...Later

...so don't expect a soliloquy out of me now. [insert profound first entry statement here] I'm tired and the video store needs me tomorrow...er later today, so I'm cutting this short at a simple and concise "Hey."
